metadata.synopsis: Insurance investigator Virginia "Gin" Baker (Catherine Zeta-Jones), looking into a stolen Rembrandt painting, suspects that accomplished thief Robert "Mac" MacDougal (Sean Connery) is responsible. She decides to go undercover and help Mac steal an ancient artifact. When a suspicious Mac confronts Gin about her real intentions, she claims that she is, in fact, a thief and that the insurance job is a cover. To prove it, she proposes a new target that could net them $8 billion.

reviews: The film itself isn't too bad as far as Hollywood thrillers go, but if Connery wasn't always there defying the ageing process, you'd probably be reaching for the remote control.
It pales in every which way when compared with any Bond film.
Heist film with reliable plot. Teens OK.
Gets by well enough on style and star chemistry and the basic allure of watching a tightly-planned caper unfold.
Connery e Zeta-Jones, com suas presenas fortes, prendem nossa ateno. O problema s comea quando, em funo do fraqussimo terceiro ato, passamos a nos atentar para as fragilidades do roteiro.
A certain sunny sloppiness almost redeems Jon Amiel's throwback caper flick
It plays more like a big-budget episode of Remington Steele or Hart to Hart.
The stars have zero chemistry and the movie is none too thrilling.
It's a superficial but entertaining caper that's a good, old-fashioned yarn.
Folks, he's literally old enough to be her grandfather.
If you think Catherine Zeta-Jones is pretty, you will like this movie quite a bit. Forgettable otherwise.
She's not who she appears to be. He's not who he appears to be. The people sitting in the row in front of you aren't who they appear to be, either. It's that kind of movie.
